VA News Release: #VA Extends Financial, Benefits and Claims Relief to #Veterans
https://t.co/iTXmGWTIkO
 #COVID19
VA helping New Jersey with its COVID-19 response efforts https://t.co/kO6Dwwc2w2
.@DeptVetAffairs, @US_FDA, @NIH Partner to Accelerate 3D-Printed Protective Gear for COVID-19 Response https://t.co/F4P9cqnbIm
@DeptVetAffairs, @US_FDA, @NIH Partner to Accelerate 3D-Printed Protective Gear for COVID-19 Response https://t.co/9o8Vq8T4JA
VA expands virtual services to support Veterans during COVID-19 pandemic: https://t.co/3Dyw2nvJVd
VA deploys Mobile Vet Center units to increase outreach during COVID-19 outbreak: https://t.co/67uF8gD1iS
VA is assisting New York City with its COVID-19 response while continuing the department’s primary mission of caring for our Nation’s Veterans: https://t.co/xHKVYifTU1
We are in the middle of 15 Days To Slow The Spread. Follow these guidelines to protect yourself and your loved ones. https://t.co/ikvRyQEiol
Thanks to @USOPM, @DeptVetAffairs is inviting retired medical personnel back to work to help us deal with the COVID-19 pandemic. Please help us spread the word https://t.co/d0XCPo0gnP
Read my @MilitaryTimes op-ed about how @DeptVetAffairs is responding to the coronavirus outbreak https://t.co/zjLGKf1ePA
RT @DeptVetAffairs: .@POTUS signed legislation today that will maintain educational benefits for Veterans and their families impacted by th…
I joined @marthamaccallum last night to discuss how VA is protecting Veterans and fighting the Coronavirus https://t.co/QoiXo1QlV2
I spoke with @ABC about VA’s efforts to care for Veterans and stop the spread of COVID-19 https://t.co/4TLqd5txxh
We all must do our part to slow the spread of the Coronavirus. Learn how by reading @POTUS’s Coronavirus Guidelines for America https://t.co/QNBdbhxTrp
For the latest VA updates on coronavirus and commonsense tips on how to protect yourself, visit https://t.co/IAeuyWdEOg

President Trump’s national emergency declaration is a decisive move that will help America contain the spread of the COVID-19 virus. It opens up billions of dollars in funding, and smartly leverages the power of private companies to quickly reach citizens.

While the risk to average Americans remains low, last night, @POTUS outlined the unprecedented steps our government is taking to protect Americans from the Coronavirus. It’s an aggressive approach that will help defeat the virus. https://t.co/lEp2tVP0eU

It was an honor to join the American Legion at its 60th Annual Washington Conference today.  I told members we are blessed to gather in the strongest, most prosperous nation on Earth because they answered the call to defend freedom and democracy. Congratulations @AmericanLegion https://t.co/DkWbXKKcpi

World War II Veteran Ernie Columbus was born February 8, 1920, and 100 years later, he celebrated his birthday with a jump from more than 10,000 feet. At VA, we’re inspired by #Veterans like Ernie.  https://t.co/cHR7fDx7KF

President Lincoln’s Second Inaugural Address was so poignant and critical to our mission today, that I have directed that it be displayed at VA Cemeteries across the country. 

https://t.co/RzzVtYGfRi

Today we honor the poignant words President Lincoln on the 155th Anniversary of his Second Inaugural Address. Although it was less than 700 words, its message echoes through the ages and contains the foundation for our service to Veterans #BornetheBattle https://t.co/Xqz1zhyAwT https://t.co/RU1bklCiVT

#WomenVeterans have played a vital role in our nation's history and continue to do so here at VA by shaping the way VA delivers care and services to their fellow Veterans. 

#WomensHistoryMonth https://t.co/QDiy19rjZc

It was great to be in Hot Springs, South Dakota, today to meet with Gov. Noem, Sens. Rounds and Thune, and Rep. Johnson. We discussed the challenges and opportunities of serving our rural #Veterans. ---- #VA https://t.co/tUKe4LZaVU

Pam Powers #VA Chief of Staff, writing in Inside Sources:  It’s our job at VA to make sure we’re ready to serve these women warriors once they transition out of the military. And I’m proud to say we are getting the job done.
https://t.co/EVnHxyyZRt 
#Veterans

Thank you Minister @L_MacAulay for meeting with me today to discuss Canadian and American #Veterans. We both are focused on helping military members transition to civilian life, ending Veteran homelessness, and supporting all Veterans. https://t.co/rxVbxRL8Sj
VA's Whole Health approach is all about getting to know our Veterans and developing a well-being plan around them https://t.co/AWkPO9RrQD

The National Veterans Golden Age Games is the premier senior adaptive rehabilitation program in the US, and the only national multi-event sports competition designed specifically to improve the quality of life for Veterans age 55 and older https://t.co/CZbDeChUfe @Sports4Vets

Buffalo Soldiers scouted and patrolled vast expanses of challenging terrain. These #Veterans provided sentinels and security for settlers, built roads, installed telegraph lines and played an integral part in @NatlParkService #history 

https://t.co/YrZCrTyzLg #BlackHistoryMonth

Since the Revolutionary War, African Americans have served with courage and distinguished service. At VA, our African American employment program ensures a strong and diverse workforce to deliver the care and benefits they earned. #blackhistorymonth https://t.co/yLobtQgzRs
Members of the New York National Guard’s 369th Infantry Regiment were the first African Americans to serve in WWI. The enemy called them “Hellfighters.” Here’s their story: https://t.co/drJXi0Ma3O
As people age, PTSD symptoms may suddenly appear or become worse. Dr. Elissa McCarthy, a VA psychologist, offers 5 strategies that may help aging Veterans. https://t.co/C9jmoeGm4H

Medal of Honor recipient Hershel “Woody” Williams and Navajo Code Talker Thomas H. Begay, both WWII Marine Corps Veterans, recall the raising of the flag on Iwo Jima 75 years ago. https://t.co/N1WLC1uDAj

I offer my deep appreciation to #NASDVA for the very important work they do everyday to serve our Veterans! Also, congratulations to the Pillar of Excellence winners for their outstanding efforts! https://t.co/777Ojmfhdk

Yesterday, I had the pleasure of meeting with South Korean Patriots and Veterans Affairs Minister Park, Sam-Duck. We discussed the care and support of Veterans in our two countries, and he expressed gratitude to America’s Veterans, especially those of the Korean War. https://t.co/LenIdL5w3K
Today, on the 75th Anniversary of the start of the Battle for Iwo Jima, we pause to honor the Navajo Code Talkers who helped ensure a @USMC victory. https://t.co/B459ejTiS6
Join us in honoring our Vietnam Veterans and their families for their service and sacrifice during one of the longest wars in our country’s history. https://t.co/b5kba2xR5b

It was an honor to join the Jewish War Veterans of America today as they gather for their 125th anniversary; it is one of American’s oldest Veterans group founded in the years following the Civil War.  We at the VA thank you  @JewishWarVets for your service to our country!” https://t.co/r5KL0SBRSn

Lt. Col. Joseph Ward was VA's first African American hospital director. His son, later became the first African American to integrate a VA hospital. Then 7 years later, VA’s first African American VA regional director. #AfricanAmericanHistory  https://t.co/NQEJLIJrZA

Calling all artists. The 2020 National Veterans Day Poster Contest is underway. The winning design will be displayed in VA facilities and military installations around the world to honor our Veterans. Submissions are due April 1, 2020. https://t.co/lMiugbrwds

This week I had the honor of recognizing some amazing women Veterans who served their country with distinction:  two survivors from the all-female 6888 Battalion and also 100 year old Marcella LeBeau who served during D-Day and in the Battle of the Bulge #HonorHiddenFigures! https://t.co/AjsjAJK8TW

Hosted by VA San Diego Healthcare System, the National Veterans Summer Sports Clinic offers adventure sports and recreational activities such as sailing, surfing, kayaking, and cycling for Veterans with disabilities. Registration is open through May 1. https://t.co/4abxa5hwyY

The National Guard and Reserve have played a significant role stateside and around the globe. These new PSAs emphasize the unique duties they have in safeguarding our country. They served us, let’s be there for them. https://t.co/oQ6PCWxIEv

When a Veteran turns to someone for help, it’s often to a spiritual leader in their community. That is why VA is training clergy and others to recognize injuries such as PTSD, make referrals for care and develop a network of community partners. https://t.co/F3l2GRehDj
Veterans are at the heart of VA’s effort to modernize the department’s electronic health record. This video offers some perspective from their point of view.   https://t.co/RCBrEI2NME
Yesterday, I gave my State of the VA address. Veterans expect more improvements and innovation from VA in 2020. https://t.co/qn32KEiE8o

Congratulations to Tuskegee Airman Charles McGee on his promotion to Brigadier General and for tossing out the coin this week at the Super Bowl.  Well deserved! #BestWeekEver! https://t.co/dmPeKYYmZZ. https://t.co/VUo157zJO3

To improve access to care, VA has partnered with Philips to provide free telehealth services at select VFW, American Legion and Walmart locations. Veterans can use VA Video Connect at those sites to talk to their VA health care provider at no cost to them. https://t.co/V4GoV8qciy

In 2019, over 61,000 people volunteered more than 9.2M hours to serve Veterans through VA’s Voluntary Service. I encourage more people to reach out to their local VA facility and volunteer. National Salute to Veteran Patients is an excellent time to start https://t.co/p0fjMvldhM

African American History Month starts Feb. 1. African American #Veterans have played a crucial role supporting and defending the Constitution through military service, from Harlem Hellfighters and Tuskegee Airmen to today's warfighters. We honor their service. #AAHM https://t.co/zc9StsyzOT
Marquette Michigan: Public Radio - WNMU-FM 90.1 -- What's going on in the VA: an interview with @SecWilkie -- https://t.co/3qF1uec52F
Congratulations to Chattanooga, TN for becoming the 11th community in the country to end Veteran homelessness. Thank you for your commitment to honor and serve our Veterans. https://t.co/ZERvQgaQpB

From VA hospitals and clinics, to community partners and urgent care, VA is making easier for Veterans to get their FREE flu vaccination. To learn where to get your shot, or about the current spread of the flu in your area https://t.co/33K9EBmAVj

South Dakota Public Broadcasting (SDPB) (Audio): #VA @SecWilkie On #Veterans’ Care --- Sec. Wilkie spoke with SDPB’s Lee Strubinger about rural health care delivery for #Veterans and tribal Veterans
https://t.co/I771UTd1xU

I’ve said we need to have a national conversation about suicide. Today that conversation went global. @NZDefenceForce Minister Ron Mark and I shared our concerns about suicide, which tragically impacts both our countries. Thanks to @RonMarkNZF for this important conversation. https://t.co/4rQZpdT3ey

See my recent OP-ED: At #VA, a Victory for Religious Freedom 
https://t.co/yFKCklTB45
#Veterans

We joined the Darren White radio show in Albuquerque, NM on KKOB-RAD 96.3(FM) to talk about #Veterans issues.
https://t.co/RfulGIzR8a
We discussed #VA priorities for #Veterans with Amarillo, Texas listeners on KGNC (AM-710/FM-97.5, Audio):  https://t.co/gaOQOHoGVZ

VA’s Video Connect lets Veterans connect from any device that has an internet connection via desktop, smartphone or tablet and receive personalized health care wherever they are. https://t.co/IfQ1zGmolJ
We welcome Jovita Carranza @SBAJovita, the 26th Administrator of @SBAgov to the Twitter community. #Veterans

RT @INDOPACOM: Veteran Affairs Secretary, Robert Wilkie, @SecWilkie and @INDOPACOM Surgeon Rear Adm. Louis Tripoli share a meal with
senior…
The first 6 months of implementing the MISSION Act has afforded Veterans with greater access to health care, and care when they need it most. https://t.co/6S4HjYPCjN

For the second year in a row, VA ranks 6th as one of the Best Places to Work in the Federal Government. @VAcareers is recruiting the finest employees to join us in serving for our nation’s #Veterans. https://t.co/ZEcwPvJC0I

Service is a powerful tool for strengthening our communities, but it is only a start. Americans can take up the challenge to experience the power of service Dr. King shared in his “Drum Major Instinct” sermon: “Everybody can be great because everyone can serve.” #MLKDay https://t.co/DID93hcIpg

VA’s Warrior to Soulmate program is helping Veterans and their spouses communicate better, deepen their connection and reintegrate into the flow of everyday life. 
https://t.co/dzjqUdCrwf
Congratulations to Senator @JerryMoran upon his confirmation as the chairman of the Senate Veterans Affairs Committee. We look forward to working together for our nation’s #Veterans.

As with my previous visits to NYC, I am always very impressed with the top notch staff, especially at our Staten Island CBOC, what an outstanding team! I also deeply appreciate talking with our Veterans. My thanks to Rep. Max Rose for his service and support to our Vets. https://t.co/hL8snWEn0J
